name: Harmony Counterstrike
description:
Spend a lot of your turns clicking for creds, Mushin, or Install Adv Adv. Not a lot of ICE, but the most taxing/painful Jinteki could muster.

If/When the runner steals those big agendas, counterstrike hard. Otherwise, its score away, get yourself at game point. Fetals are just for show, never score them, only counterstrike bait/trap.

name: The Transaction Reaction
description:
Why not make good cards better? Why not have all your economy in cards that the runner can't burn. Why not have most of it replace itself?

The other thing I wanted to try was using Matrix Analyizer in conjunction with advancement ice to make runs incrementally more expensive each time, or to sneak a few extra advancement tokens on a newly installed agenda.

name: HB-Rezurrect
description: Biggest ICE. Lowest price.

name: NBN-lapporna rockar (V)
description: Tags'n'stuff

name: Jinteki-No ICE please.
description: Pricks and needles.

name: Noise Knightmare
description:
This is an evolution of Reina's Master Key.

I found out that Reina's deck wasn't particularly effective, especially against Weyland and it's treasury.

So, I switched to Noise instead. Plan is unchanged. Hit RnD hard, parasucker ices and then switch to HQ with Nerve Agent if necessary.

Medium seems like a strange addition, but it's effective if you Keyhole,Keyhole,Keyhole and then Medium theirs RnD.

Float/Ignore tag. If tagged, then Liberated Account, creds, creds, creds, is a good choice, leaving 4 creds on Liberated Account and force Corp to either ignore it, or lose click and 2 creds. A fair trade off in my book and a win-win situation.

name: Vacuum Cleaner
description: Vacuum Cleaner, look at this deck, and I think it is enough.

name: Noise Feedback Knightmare
description:
This is an evolution of Reina's Master Key and updated version of Noise Knightmare.

I found out that Reina's deck wasn't particularly effective, especially against Weyland and it's treasury. Weyland is very common in my local meta.

So, I switched to Noise instead. Plan is unchanged. Hit RnD hard, parasucker ices and then switch to HQ with Nerve Agent if necessary.

Medium seems like a strange addition, but it's effective if you Keyhole,Keyhole,Keyhole and then Medium their RnD.

Float/Ignore tag. If tagged, then Liberated Account, creds, creds, creds, is a good choice, leaving 4 creds on Liberated Account and force Corp to either ignore it, or lose click and 2 creds. A fair trade off in my book and a win-win situation.

Also, changes from Reina's Master key are: -1 grimmoire, +1 medium - Grimmoire wasn't very useful. Memory wasn't an issue (Knight/Parasites get trashed anyway) and the extra virus token were rarely critical.

and also -1 datasucker (don't really need 3 and I can tutor them anyway with djin) -1 yog, -1 corroder +3 cyberfeeder for economy (helpful for Knight and virus installation) I didn't dare to have less than 2 mimics though since Rototurret and Archers are everywhere in my meta.

The fact that I have one decoder and one fracter makes me nervous, but I can kill ice anyway or just use knight.

Common tactics: 1. Facecheck ice early on when you are naked. Once rezed, parasite them. Keep facechecking 2. Don't be afraid to use Knight on an unrezed ice on HQ and account syphon them. Float tags if corp is broke or if you have plascrete 3. Tutor medium or nerve agent depending if corp has heavy defense on RnD or HQ.

name: Chaos Theory's powerful pet.
description: My current tournent deck. It hurts to leave Kate but CTs ability to have the 5 mu I need to install the full rig without dinosaurus is just too good. This leaves me the ability to pressure early and scavenge Femme onto Dino when I'm ready. Account Siphon abuse because it's just so good. my only real complaint with this deck, I have a low chance to draw Corroder which means test run is the only way to tutor it out. It's still a strong deck because the Femme and torch are such a bargain I can afford to dig a little for Corroder or pay a premium.

name: Travis Day - Plugged In Winner
description: As played Garden Grove Plugged-In Tour

name: Fatal DinoGirls
description: Dinosaurus to host Femme Fatale (Test Run+Eureka!). Test Run and Diesel to install Magnum Opus asap. It's quite an aggressive deck. Inside Job will help for early game naked runs. Tinkering is here to maximize Battering Ram and Gordian Blade ability to maintain the strenght for the entire run and use it for multiple ICEs. HQ and R&D Interface + Maker's Eye will allow to run for exceptional devastating runs on centrals and focus then on remotes.

name: KitKnight
description: I cannot draw cards well in Kit decks. Either I get all econ, all tutoring, or all breakers, but never a balance :).

name: Single Core Set NBN 1.0
description: Two words: Economic superiority. This deck aims to render lose-lose situations for runner. It's founded on strong economy and lots of tagging that either keeps the runner poor (if he loses the tags) or gives opportunity to score with Psychographics and eventually keeps the runner poor with Closed Accounts. Scoring PSF cuts the second option.

name: WYLD: GRNDL 3.0
Jackson Grendel
description:
First time building a deck.

Haven't tested this yet.

Basically, you can go into the Accelerated Diagnostics + Power Shutdown + Jackson Howard + Scorched Earth.

From a member on CardGameDB: http://www.cardgamedb.com/forums/index.php?/topic/13345-accelerated-diagnostics-power-shutdown-jackson-howard-scorched-earth/

"The game plan was to try and score either The Cleaners or an over-advanced Project Atlas early so that I can either fetch the cards I need early or make a double scorch kill land even through a Plascrete. Then the goal was to get Sea Source + Double Scorch. If I am forced to use one of the Scorches prematurely or it ends up in Archives somehow, I'd use the combo as a backup way to get to it."

No idea which ICE to use, though.

name: Single Core Set NBN 1.1
description:
A tiny bit more aggressive version of the previous deck. I wanted to make room for Ichi, so here he comes (no need to introduce since his reputation precedes) with few more changes.

Strategy in two words: Economic superiority. This deck aims to render lose-lose situations for runner. It's founded on strong economy and lots of tagging that either keeps the runner poor (if he loses the tags) or gives opportunity to score with Psychographics and eventually keeps the runner poor with Closed Accounts. Scoring PSF cuts the second option.

name: Noise rebirth 0.5
description:
New iteration of that Noise-Keyhole deck. Decided to replace Wyldside by Mr Li as a draw engine and to add 1 Stimhack to the mix even though it puts the deck at 46 cards.

Deck still doesn't feel quite there yet though. 2 influence to spare but not too sure what I could/would swap out of this deck. Maybe replace 1 Mimic by a Femme Fatale?

name: Next Level GRNDL
Professional Spy v1.0
description: I'm really looking forward to Silhouette, but in the meantime here is my attempt at a Gabe Blackguard build.

name: Light up the Knight 1.0
description: My 2nd take on Kit utilizing knights this time around. This deck bleeds Mu. Requires testing to see how it can apply, but I feel like the Garrote on a Dinosaursus is fairly strong late game and not exactly out of reach with tools like PW and Scavenge at our disposal. Late game this rig is fine with gaining six credits and running RnD.

name: Your Trash Is My Treasure
description:
Three tricks here, all meant to load up the Archives with agenda for a Hail Mary run. The first is Noise, pretty standard: play viruses, mill. Easy. Second is Keyhole: Parasite/Datasucker and/or AI codebreaker your way into R&D for a more selective mill. Third is more complicated: drop a Data Leak Reversal and a John Masanori. Click one: make a run and fail, get tagged. Click two and three: mill. Click four: remove the tag. Stop only to gain money for tag removal.

Sure Gamble, Gorman Drip v1, Liberated Account, and to some extent Cyberfeeder all keep you in the money. Grimoire and Djinn handle MU and serve double duty. Grimoire helps Surge pump up your viruses to surprise the Corp with Darwin, Datasucker, Parasite, you name it. Djinn tutors more viruses. Deep Thought helps to know what you've milled with Noise or Data Leak Reversal. Deja Vu to revirus or grab up a money card. Imp is a replaceable virus filling space.

name: Alpha Ice Destruction
description: Alpha / Omega + ice destruction keeps runners in trouble.

name: Chaos of Account Siphon
Your Trash Is My Treasure
description:
Three tricks here, all meant to load up the Archives with agenda for a Hail Mary run. The first is Noise, pretty standard: play viruses, mill. Easy. Second is Keyhole: Parasite/Datasucker and/or AI codebreaker your way into R&D for a more selective mill. Third is more complicated: drop a Data Leak Reversal and a John Masanori. Click one: make a run and fail, get tagged. Click two and three: mill. Click four: remove the tag. Stop only to gain money for tag removal, unless you dropped a Crash Space early.

Sure Gamble, Gorman Drip v1, Liberated Account, and to some extent Cyberfeeder all keep you in the money. Grimoire and Djinn handle MU and serve double duty. Grimoire helps Surge pump up your viruses to surprise the Corp with Darwin, Datasucker, Parasite, you name it. Djinn tutors more viruses. Deep Thought helps to know what you've milled with Noise or Data Leak Reversal. Deja Vu to revirus or grab up a money card.

name: Naughty or Nice v2
description:
Taking inspiration from tacullu. Out of the box thinking of recurring blackmail once BP is established and bypassing ice completely.

Find your Activist Support, Aesop's, and NACH as fast as you can. When you do, get them down and make sure you have 2 credits to avoid the tag. Heck, even NACH and AS is enough, just make sure you have the money and just draw into Aesop's later.

On tempo holes, draw cards to get your econ and blackmails, SOT. LALA away as needed.

name: Professional Thief v3.3
description: Switched back to Gorman Drip.

name: Red Queen's Master Key
description: Let the knights go (I love them) to protect myself a little more against the shutdown combo. Nerve Agente + Demolition Run + Imp to trash those damn combo cards. Kati Jones keeps eco up.

name: Gabriel Knight v2
description: A Frankenstein's Monster, assembled from Asroybal and Indalamar's Knight-based Gabe builds. For testing.

name: Another Kit Atman Yog
NBN - Rush
Jinteki Cannon
description: Idea im toying with. Use SanSan and Kaguya to quickly build Ronins up for Flatline. Mid-range ICE with lots of Ops. Couple of ambushes thrown in to keep them guessing - hitting either Junebug or Snare with EMP / charged Ronin could also be lethal. Using research station to max out opportunities for holding operations as well as to focus running onto HQ.

name: Trojan Horse
description: In this deck it's important to install Djinn very soon. Use Personal Touch with Darwin. Femme Fatal is used to break big ICE and Swordsman. Thinking about a couple of Keyholes...

name: Andi maintaining her contacts
description:
This deck was kinda a challenge for me, cause everyone was telling me that underworld contacts are not really viable. I really like them, so i started to build a deck around this card with several identities. In the end i ended up beeing third with an andromeda version at the Store Championship in Aachen, Germany, winning every game as a runner.

So how does this deck work:

Starting Hand: For your starting hand you want, if possible, the following cards:

  1. Sure Gamble / Easy Mark
  2. Hostage / Mr. Li
  3. Access to Globalsec / Helpful Ai
  4. Kati / Underworld Contacts / Daily Cast
  5. Fearie / Testrun / Special Order
  6. Inside Job / Forged Acitvation Order ... Rest doesnt matter

Against Weyland you also wanna have a decoy or another hostage if possible.

How to play: This deck doesnt put a lot of pressure on the corp in the beginning, although it can if you feel like you have a fast advance deck in front of you (Inside Job + Forged Activation Order!). Dont worry about the corp getting rich, you will at least get the same amount of money.

Normal Turn Order would be:

  1. Using Mr. Li (you want to find your Ice-breaker)
  2. Whatever you want (Play Card / Another Time Mr. Li / Play Hostage)
  3. Maybe a Run / Play A Card
  4. Use Kati

Games might take ages, but in the end you should be able to get through every server. Its fine if the corp scores one agenda in the beginning. Later on you should have the upper hand. If you feel like you are facing a combo deck, make sure to always trash their jackson ASAP. Against Wayland and Jinteki you probably also want to have your Raymond Flint out as well. Make sure to keep your Testrun in hand for as long as possible, just in case your last sentry/codegate/barrier breaker gets trashed. Once you have your Garrote in play, you should be fine.

Let me know what you think. And yeah, i know, account siphon might be missing, but i hate getting tags. :D Although this deck is really not about keeping the corp poor.

name: Aproximación a la victoria por maximización de acciones
description: El objetivo principal es ganar con Fast Advance con el click extra de la Directora Haas. Para optimizar el ecosistema donde La Directora se pueda instalar y desarrollar se maximizan los click destinados a ello: -Robando (anonimous Tip) -Robar y ganar dinero (Blue and Green LC) -Instalando (El poder de NEXT DESING y Shipment from MirrorMorph)

name: Russian Jackson 2nd Place Common Room Games - Store Champion
description: Get going as fast as possible and rush out those agenda points. If I don't start with an Astro, I'll usually mulligan. I've been known to score an astro first turn with Biotic and Shipment to SanSan. Biggest worry in this deck is making sure they don't just beat you off of R&D. Always keep something facedown on HQ to avoid the Siphon. Found that Grim is great and can really slow them down looking for that Corroder again.

name: Kit's Red Dress
description:
Novice deckbuilder alert!

Rig of Yogosaurus + Omega to get into servers up to 2 ice pretty reliably. Support of datasuckers + parasite to deal with things that mess that up. One ofs of Deus Ex and Sharpshooter for more protection. Plenty of tutoring to get out what you need when you need it, as well as a bit of recursion.

Kit works best with one run a turn (excepting light runs to charge datasucker), WITRD helps you decide whether to hit R&D or HQ, with the HQ interfaces helping pull that agenda you just revealed if the corp draws it.

Not sure if Motivation is worth it, figure it may come in handy to pair with Eureka.
